opennlp.ccg.grammar
Interface Rule

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractApplicationRule, AbstractCompositionRule, AbstractRule, AbstractSubstitutionRule, AbstractTypeRaisingRule, BackwardApplication, BackwardComposition, BackwardSubstitution, BackwardTypeRaising, ForwardApplication, ForwardComposition, ForwardSubstitution, ForwardTypeRaising, FragmentJoining, GlueRule, TypeChangingRule
public interface Rule

Interface for categorial rules.

Version:
$Revision: 1.5 $, $Date: 2009/11/30 20:36:15 $
Author:
Gann Bierner, Jason Baldridge, Michael White

Method Summary
 List<Category> applyRule(Category[] inputs)
          Apply this rule to some input categories.
 int arity()
          The number of arguments this rule takes.
 RuleGroup getRuleGroup()
          Returns the rule group which contains this rule.
 String name()
          Returns the interned name of this rule.
 void setRuleGroup(RuleGroup ruleGroup)
          Sets this rule's rule group.
 

Method Detail

applyRule

List<Category> applyRule(Category[] inputs)
                         throws UnifyFailure
Apply this rule to some input categories.

Parameters:
inputs - the input categories to try to combine
Returns:
the Category (or categories) resulting from using this Rule to combine the inputs
Throws:
UnifyFailure - if the inputs cannot be combined by this Rule

arity

int arity()
The number of arguments this rule takes. For example, the arity of the forward application rule of categorial grammar (X/Y Y => Y) is 2.

Returns:
the number of arguments this rule takes

name

String name()
Returns the interned name of this rule.

getRuleGroup

RuleGroup getRuleGroup()
Returns the rule group which contains this rule.

setRuleGroup

void setRuleGroup(RuleGroup ruleGroup)
Sets this rule's rule group.
